message_1: Consider the type theory system where the only allowed types are natural numbers (represented as N) and functions (represented as =>). Define a function f : N => (N => N) as f(x)(y) = x + y. Find the result of f(3)(7).
message_2:
To find the result of f(3)(7), we simply need to apply the function definition to the given input values.

f(x)(y) = x + y

f(3)(7) = 3 + 7 = 10

So, the result of f(3)(7) is 10.
